metadata.title: CVE-2024-50212 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:lib: alloc_tag_module_unload must wait for pending kfree_rcu callsBen Greear reports following splat: ------------[ cut here ]------------ net/netfilter/nf_nat_core.c:1114 module nf_nat func:nf_nat_register_fn has256 allocated at module unload WARNING: CPU: 1 PID: 10421 at lib/alloc_tag.c:168alloc_tag_module_unload+0x22b/0x3f0 Modules linked in: nf_nat(-) btrfs ufs qnx4 hfsplus hfs minix vfat msdosfat... Hardware name: Default string Default string/SKYBAY, BIOS 5.12 08/04/2020 RIP: 0010:alloc_tag_module_unload+0x22b/0x3f0  codetag_unload_module+0x19b/0x2a0  ? codetag_load_module+0x80/0x80nf_nat module exit calls kfree_rcu on those addresses, but the freeoperation is likely still pending by the time alloc_tag checks for leaks.Wait for outstanding kfree_rcu operations to complete before checkingresolves this warning.Reproducer:unshare -n iptables-nft -t nat -A PREROUTING -p tcpgrep nf_nat /proc/allocinfo # will list 4 allocationsrmmod nft_chain_natrmmod nf_nat                # will WARN.[akpm@linux-foundation.org: add comment]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4

No subscription required

linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').

linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').

linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
